Examine the influence of introducing an integral transformation \\( T(u) = \\int k(x, y)u(y)dy \\) where \\( k(x, y) \\) is the kernel of the transformation.

Can we deduce the original function \\( u_0 \\) at t = 0 after observing \\( u(t) \\) at t = T without knowing whether \\( T(u) \\) was applied?
